titlStmt.titl: What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2011

citation.biblCit: Bukutu, Cecilia; Hanson, Tara; Tough, Suzanne, 2016, "What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2011", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10802, UAL Dataverse, V6

titlStmt.titl: What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) 2011

stdyInfo.abstract:
What Albertan Adults Know About Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) is a computer-assisted telephone survey of 1200 Albertan adults. It is a portion of the 2011b Alberta Survey (doi:10.7939/DVN/10006) conducted by the Population Research Lab, and commissioned by PolicyWise for Children & Families (formerly the Alberta Centre for Child, Family and Community Research) using Alberta Health funding. Ten questions were asked relating to general knowledge about Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder; personal experience related to FASD; and attitudes concerning prevention.

These metadata are also available through SAGE's searchable metadata website:
http://sagemetadata.policywise.com/nada/index.php/catalog/4

sumDscr.geogCover: Edmonton, Alberta; Calgary, Alberta; Rest of Alberta
sumDscr.universe: Individuals over the age of 18 who could be contacted by direct dialing were eligible for inclusion. Where an adult male exists in the household and agreed to be interviewed, he was the respondent (to more likely reach an equal balance of males and females, since males respond less often than females); otherwise an adult female who agrees to be interviewed is the respondent. Of the 1200 Albertans targeted, 400 were from Calgary, 400 from Edmonton, and the balance from the rest of Alberta.

dataColl.weight: Weighted using 'wtx' variable to match 2011 Alberta Population

dataAccs.notes:
We are accepting proposals for our 2018 Secondary Data Use Grant starting February 20, 2018. This grant provides $5,000 to successful applicants to undertake research using data in SAGE. The term of the grant is 12 months. The grant offers an excellent opportunity for trainees and new researchers to work with existing birth cohort and survey data. Deadline for applications is April 27, 2018 at 4:00 PM MST.

https://policywise.com/initiatives/sage/secondary-data-use-grant/

No special access conditions or procedures beyond the standard SAGE data access protocol. See: https://policywise.com/initiatives/sage/accessing-data/
